intro: Gynandropsis phoenicea, commonly known as the golden daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal regions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are composed of both ray and disk florets. Gynandropsis phoenicea is adapted to arid environments and is often used in ornamental gardening due to its striking appearance.
